faq.title: What is DARIAH?
faq.content:
DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

To learn more, check out [dariah.eu](https://www.dariah.eu/).

faq.title: What is DARIAH-Campus?
faq.content: DARIAH-Campus is a discovery framework and hosting platform for learning resources. It was developed as a pilot in the context of the H2020-funded project [DESIR](https://www.dariah.eu/activities/projects-and-affiliations/desir/). Today, it is one of the core services of [DARIAH](https://www.dariah.eu/).

faq.title: Is DARIAH-Campus exhaustive?
faq.content: Definitely not. But we're constantly adding new content. If you can think of ways to contribute or if you know of resources that should be represented on DARIAH-Campus, feel free to get in touch.

faq.title: How to get in touch?
faq.content: The easiest way for you to get in touch with us is by using the [DARIAH Help Desk](https://www.dariah.eu/helpdesk/). Make sure you select "Education and training" as the subject of your message.

faq.title: What is DARIAH-Campus powered by?
faq.content: In addition to being powered by an enthusiasm for research infrastructures and an awareness of the importance of training and education for building sustainable RIs, DARIAH-Campus is a [Next.js](https://www.nextjs.org)-powered website hosted on [Vercel](https://www.vercel.com/).
